name: vernalize
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ T ] to make seeds or plants cold for a time so that they start growing: The seeds may need to be vernalized to obtain adequate germination. Collected seed can either be vernalised, or it can be stored dry in paper bags or kept in the fridge until spring.
[ I ] (of a seed or plant) to go through this process: Germinated seedlings were allowed to vernalize at 8–10°C for 2 months under continuous fluorescent light. Plants were allowed to vernalise naturally over winter, and examinations began in the spring.
